p: The landscape photographs from the field survey points were evaluated by visual interpretation. It was easy to identify the individuals or the homogenous patches of common milkweed in the field photos ( Figure A1) because of the characteristic morphological features of the plants (e.g., bright and shiny green leaves and occasionally purple inflorescences). Based on the presence of common milkweed in at least one of the four photographs taken at each point, survey points were classified as 0 (no common milkweed present) and 1 (common milkweed is present; site is invaded by common milkweed) [ 12].
